clinical_study.brief_title: Differential Diagnostics of Etiology of Acute Infections
clinical_study.official_title: Differential Diagnostics of Etiology of Acute Infections Based on the Analysis of Expression of Activation Markers on the Surface of Peripheral Blood Monocytes and Neutrophils.

lead_sponsor.agency: The Republican Research and Practical Center for Epidemiology and Microbiology

clinical_study.source: The Republican Research and Practical Center for Epidemiology and Microbiology

brief_summary.textblock: Method for diagnostics of the origin of infections (bacterial vs viral) based on the identification of activation markers of blood neutrophils and monocytes will be developed.

detailed_description.textblock:
During the study, method for diagnostics of the origin of infections (bacterial vs viral) based on the identification of activation markers of blood neutrophils and monocytes will be developed.This method will allow to make a diagnosis within an hour after blood sampling.
The expression of the following markers of activation will be studied using flow cytometry: CD11b, CD11c, CD13, CD16, CD32, CD35, CD38, CD62L, CD64, CD66b, CD88, CD284, HLA-ABC and HLA-DR.

primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity of the diagnosis of bacterial vs viral acute infection
primary_outcome.description: Sensitivity of the diagnosis of bacterial vs viral acute infection using proposed method

primary_outcome.measure: Specificity of the diagnosis of bacterial vs viral acute infection
primary_outcome.description: Specificity of the diagnosis of bacterial vs viral acute infection using proposed method
